org.smtlib

Interface ISort

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAccept, IPos.IPosable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISort.IApplication, ISort.IFcnSort, ISort.IParameter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Sort, Sort.Application, Sort.FcnSort, Sort.Parameter

    public interface ISort
extends IAccept, IPos.IPosable
    The interface for an SMT-LIB concept of a Sort. Two kinds of things are modeled here.

    First, a definition of a Sort, modeled by ISort.IDefinition. There are these kinds of definitions:

    • an ISort.IFamily, which defines a new sort symbol of a given arity
    • an ISort.IAbbreviation, which defines a (possibly parameterized) abbreviation for a sort expression.
    • an ISort.IParameter, which defines a sort name used as a parameter in an abbreviation definition
    • The ISort.ErrorDefinition class, which is used as a definition place holder for ill-formed definitions, to avoid excessive redundant errors
    Second, Sort expressions themselves, modeled by ISort:
    • A ISort.IApplication, which is the application of an IDefinition to the appropriate number (possible 0) of Sort expressions
    • A ISort.IParameter, which is a simple symbol designating the parameter of a parameterized abbreviation
    • A ISort.IFcnSort, an expression designating a function sort; this is not expressible in SMT-LIBv2, but is useful internally within jSMTLIB.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ISort.ErrorDefinition
      This class is an instance of a sort definition that represents an erroneous definition of a Sort; by defining an actual IDefinition, excessive propagation of errors is avoided.
      static interface  ISort.IAbbreviation
      This interface represents a new Sort symbol designating an abbreviation for a (possibly parameterized) sort expression.
      static interface  ISort.IApplication
      The interface for a Sort expression that consists of either an arity 0 sort symbol or a positive-arity symbol with the appropriate number of arguments.
      static interface  ISort.IDefinition
      A super-interface for definitions of new sort ids.
      static interface  ISort.IFactory
      The interface for a Sort-creating factory
      static interface  ISort.IFamily
      This interface represents a new Sort symbol designating either a new Sort (if the arity is 0) or a new parameterized Sort family (if the arity is greater than 0); each new symbol has a (new) name and a non-negative arity.
      static interface  ISort.IFcnSort
      An interface to represent the Sort of a function; this is not something that can be written as a sort expression in SMT-LIB, but it is convenient to be able to represent the sorts of function ids uniformly with the sorts of other ids.
      static interface  ISort.IParameter
      The interface for a sort parameter, as used in sort abbreviations (including in the defining expression).

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.util.Map<ISort.IParameter,ISort> leftmap, ISort s, java.util.Map<ISort.IParameter,ISort> rightmap, SymbolTable symTable)
      Structural equality after expansion of abbreviations (as looked up in the symbol table) and substitution of free parameters according to the respective maps.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Structural equality after expansion of abbreviations, but without any substitution of free parameters.
      boolean equalsNoExpand(ISort sort)
      Compares sort expressions without abbreviation expansion or parameter substitution
      ISort expand()
      Expands all abbreviations
      boolean isBool()
      Returns true if the receiver designates the Bool pre-defined Sort.
      ISort substitute(java.util.Map<ISort.IParameter,ISort> map)
      Returns a new sort with any parameters substituted
